instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S5_L: What is PM_SLP_S5_L? PM_SLP_S5_L is a signal that, when 3.3v, turns on power rails that will wake the system from an S5 state. This signal is a part of the power management system of the MacBook.  The \"PM\" prefix typically stands for \"Power Management,\" and the \"SLP\" is for \"Sleep.\" The \"S5\" denotes the specific sleep state, which is Suspend to Disk, and the \"_L\" suffix indicates that this is an active low signal..
definitions.S4_PWR_EN: What is S4_PWR_EN? S4_PWR_EN turns on the S4 power rails. Signals ending in _EN enable whatever came before _EN in the signal name when the voltage of the signal is high. .
definitions.P5VS4RS3_EN: What is P5VS4RS3_EN? PP5VS4RS3_EN is a signal that enables the PP5V_S4RS3 power rail. When you see _EN in front of a signal name, it means that it is enabling whatever comes before the _EN when the signal is high..
definitions.ISL6259: What is ISL6259? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2010 through 2015.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.U1950: What is U1950? This chip often becomes corroded on pin 8 on the PP3V42_G3H pin causing PM_SLP_S4_L to go missing.
definitions.PPRTC_G3H: What is PPRTC_G3H? This is a typo of PPVRTC_G3H When you see PPRTC_G3H, assume they meant to type PPVRTC_G3H.

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
Hi all

I've got a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. When I connect the magsafe the fan spins then stops, then spins then stops but no start.
green light on charger :

<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> ok
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> ok
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> ok

no <SIGNAL>P5VS4RS3_EN</SIGNAL>
no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S5_L</SIGNAL>
no <SIGNAL>SMC_S4_WAKESRC_EN</SIGNAL>
no <SIGNAL>S4_PWR_EN</SIGNAL>
no <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL>

no short

any ideas ?

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message: Resistance between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of the <CHIP>ISL6259</CHIP>? Any history liquid etc?

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
Toooooooooooooo many "no" there.
Imposible, if the fan spins...
So check if all coils get pulse at least.
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulse too?

Catch the voltages when the fan spins, of course.

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
when the fan spins
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> : 3.35v    2 second

I don't know the history

thks

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
Any pulse at CPU coils too?
Check for pulses at <CHIP>U1950</CHIP>, pins 7 & 3.

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
<CHIP>U1950</CHIP> pin 7 and 3 = 3.43v (fan spin)

When i connect the magsafe the first time , no boot (green light and orange )
When i connect the second time , the fan turns then stop (green light and orange )

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message:
Check if all voltages from page 58 appear.
Yopu should get CPU voltage too.

Start removing SSD, this can generate strange issues if bad...
Also start without flex connected between MLB and LIO board.

threads.title: 820 3437 then spin , then stop .
threads.message: Check that you're getting <SIGNAL>PPRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> at the rest of the board, not just on <CAPACITOR>C1910</CAPACITOR>
